description: Alterations to rear garden area, addition of refuse area and bicycle store, reduction in number of parking spaces, of side pavement and front garden area.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (02, 2023-06/01, Design and Access Statement and Unnumbered Site Location Plan. Received on 06/10/2023; 03 Rev D. Received on 18/04/2024) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the buildings are used.
Condition : 3 - The development shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the materials approved under 00550/198/P4.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out, other than as shown in the approved drawings, and no additional floor space shall be formed within the building(s) hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division (new mezzanine level) without prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Condition : 5 - The windows formed in the side elevations of the existing building at 198 Hampton Road West as approved under 00550/198/P4, shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired otherwise than with obscure glazing.

Condition : 6 - Within six months of the date of this decision, all landscaping comprised in the approved details shall be carried and the boundary treatment to the front, side and rear gardens shall be erected as shown on the drawing numbered 03 Rev D. 

The visibility splay areas along the front and side garden of 198 Hampton Road West shall be kept clear of any obstructions to visibility greater than 600 mm in height, including shrubs, planting, boundary walls, fences, gates, other means of enclosure or other structures or objects at all times.

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' living conditions and to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and area.

Condition : 7 - Within six months of the date of this decision, the existing vehicular access to the front of 198 Hampton Road West shall be permanently closed and the kerbs and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Condition : 8 - The development shall take place in accordance with the details contained within the approved remediation method statement under 00550/198/P4(8) and scheme of validation report under 00550/198/P4(8D).

If additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development, the agreed scheme for decontamination referred to in clause c), shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report referred to in clause d), shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 9 - The development shall be implemented in accordance with the details set out in the Energy Statement and Renewable Energy Contribution Report by Elmhurst Energy Services; Environmental Noise Assessment ref: CH/ENA/2011/15v1 (updated 06/06/2012) approved under 00550/198/P4. The development shall thereafter be maintained and retained as such.

Condition : 10 - The development shall be implemented in accordance with the details set out in the Environmental Noise Assessment ref: CH/ENA/2011/15v1 (updated 06/06/2012) approved under 00550/198/P4. The development shall thereafter be maintained and retained as such.
Condition : 11 - The drainage scheme approved under 00550/198/P4 shall be carried out in compliance with the approved details. The development shall thereafter be maintained and retained as such.

Condition : 12 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the Sustainable Design and Construction Statement rev A approved under 00550/198/P4. The development shall thereafter be maintained and retained as such.

Condition : 13 - Within 6 months of the date of this decision, waste and recyclable materials containers shall be stored in the refuse and recycling bin enclosure hereby approved at the front of the existing building at 198 Hampton Road West, as shown on the drawing numbered 03 Rev D. The waste and recycling facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 14 - Within six months of the date of this decision, secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than two bicycles) hereby approved for the occupants of the existing building at 198 Hampton Road West shall be installed in each rear garden. The cycle parking facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times without obstruction.
